thread.title: Athletes of the Week: Brandon Porter and Stevie Gaskell
thread.title_full: Athletes of the Week: Brandon Porter and Stevie Gaskell

title: Athletes of the Week: Brandon Porter and Stevie Gaskell
text: Sport: Prep Girls Cross Country School: Sultana Grade: Senior This week’s accomplishment: Gaskell finished second in Wednesday’s MRL cluster meet, then won the sweepstakes race at the Inland Empire Challenge on Saturday in a personal record 17 minutes, 15 seconds. What do you like most about your sport: I like the fact that it is an individual sport but a team sport at the same time. How long have you been playing your sport and how did you get started: I have been running since the seventh grade, but I started at 9 years old. Pregame ritual: My pregame ritual is a long warmup then I change my shoes and at the line I pray for a good race. Most memorable sports moment: I would have to say making state last year and winning the Inland Empire Challenge. Hobby: Running Career goal: I want to teach and hopefully go to the Olympics. Favorite subject: History. If you could be someone else for a day, who would it be and why: Coach Mahr or coach Bonner because they are a huge inspiration to me and have done so much. Who would play you in a movie about your life: Evanna Lynch What kind of movie would it be: Comedy Something most people don’t know about you: It takes a lot to make me mad, but when I do I explode. Where would you go if you could travel anywhere in the world: Germany Favorite sports team: The Falcons Favorite athlete: Steve Prefontaine Favorite TV show: “Rizzoli and Isles” Favorite movie: “10 Things I Hate About You” Favorite song: “Mama’s Broken Heart” by Miranda Lambert Favorite meal: Spaghetti Favorite local restaurant: Giuseppe’s Favorite app: Facebook For more sports talk, visit http://910cbssports.cbslocal.com .
